intro: Corydalis emanueli var. pallidiflora, commonly known as the pale-flowered corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and clusters of small, delicate flowers. The flowers are typically pale pink to white in color, with two prominent upper petals and two lower, spurred petals. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories.
